body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] Write a descriptive title.
- [X] Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- [X] Search the existing issues.
- [X] Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- [X] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell).

### Steps to reproduce

On my new fresh installed Windows 11, I found powershell is nearly disabled. LanguageMode was set to ConstrainedLanguage and __PSLockdownPolicy set to 4.

$ExecutionContext.SessionState.LanguageMode
ConstrainedLanguage
$Env:__PSLockdownPolicy
4

Two questions:
1. Where and who can I found set this?
2. How to revert it back? 


### Expected behavior

```console
$ExecutionContext.SessionState.LanguageMode show to Fulllanguage and $Env:__PSLockdownPolicy show be null.
```


### Actual behavior

```console
LanguageMode was set to ConstrainedLanguage and __PSLockdownPolicy set to 4.
Most scripts can't run.
```


### Error details

```console
$ExecutionContext.SessionState.LanguageMode="FullLanguage"
InvalidOperation: Cannot set property. Property setting is supported only on core types in this language mode.
```


### Environment data

```powershell
$PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.1.5
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.1.5
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.22000
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```


### Visuals

_No response_

comments.author: HuAaron
comments.body:
I found that the env $Env:__PSLockdownPolicy (value 4) was added by company group policy. Remove that get it works.
Thanks.

title: How can I find who changed powershell languagemode and how I can revert it?
